cheatsheet.title: Other actions available for testing trees

intro.description: This cheat sheet presents some of the other options available to test trees in GUIdancer.

item.title: Checking a node exists
item.description: From the unbound modules, browse to the category: Actions (basic) > Check > Tree

subitem.label: You will see that there are two Test Cases to check if a node exists in a tree.
The Test Cases differ in the way the path to the node is given (indexpath or textpath).

As well as the path (and, for the textpath option, operator) parameters, you also have to enter the path type (relative or absolute), how many nodes to pre-ascend, and whether you expect the node you specify to exist or not (true/false).

item.title: Checking the text of a node
item.description: From the unbound modules, browse to the category: Actions (basic) > Check > Tree.

subitem.label: You will see that there are Test Cases to check the text of a selected node and to check the test at the mouse position.
To execute the "selected node" Test Case, you must have already selected the node.
To execute the "mouse position" Test Case, you must have selected the node with 0 clicks (i.e. hovered over the node).
The Test Cases require the following parameters: the text to check, and the operator to perform the check with (simple match, equals, matches or not equals).

item.title: Storing the value on a node
item.description: From the unbound modules, browse to the category: Actions (basic) > Store > Tree.

subitem.label: You will see that there is a Test Case to store the value of a selected node and a Test Case to store the value of the node where the mouse is.
To execute the "Store Text of selected node" Test Case, you must have already selected the node, e.g. with one click.
To execute the "Store text of node at mouse position" Test Case, you must have already selected the node with 0 clicks (i.e. hovered over the node).
The Test Cases require the variable name you wish to store the value in. Use $VARIABLE_NAME when you use the variable in another Test Case.
